title: golang.org website errors when changing the examples on firefox
body:
by **kikito**: 
This is not really a go! language bug, but a problem on its website. Updating with hg
would make no difference since I'm not actually using the language at all.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Go to golang.org using Firefox (I'm using Firefox 3.6 over Ubuntu, but I doubt that
matters)
2. Choose one example from the drop-down at the bottom of the page (It reads
"Hello, Word!" by default)

What is the expected output?

The expected output is the result of computing the selected example. If I choose
"Fibonacci Closure", for example, I should see a Fibonacci Closure of some
sort.


What do you see instead?

On the div on top of the drop-down list, I see the text [object XMLDocument]

A new div appears after the drop-down list with the messages:

prog.go:1: package statement must be first
prog.go:1: syntax error: unexpected name, expecting ]

This happens with all the examples. The "Hello World" one only works when the
page is first loaded. If I choose another example (and see errors) and then move back to
"Hello World", I get the same error messages.

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?

No idea, whatever the web server is using.

Which operating system are you using?
I'm in Ubuntu Maverick, but I doubt that will be pertinent for this issue.

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
I can't access your web server so I have no idea.


Please provide any additional information below.
I've tried it under Chrome and it seems to work. Could be a firefox-only thing.
